{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3561154,"name":"Robert","username":"Robert2","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/e8c25b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-18T22:05:37.641Z","cooked":"

After getting back from a competition we tried to re-program the radio and are unable to connect over WiFi. We followed Vivid-Hosting documentation for re-programming:

frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net

Quick Start Guide | FIRST FRC Radio

https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/overview/programming-your-radio-at-home

After re-programming we were able to see in wifi “FRC-8604”, but were unable to connect.

We then tried using a second brand new radio and cannot upload the firmware, or configure the team number, and keys.

Is this an issue for anyone else, and does anyone know a fix?

Connect via ethernet cable and you should be able to access it.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-03-19T00:43:53.045Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":47,"readers_count":46,"score":9.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":496135,"topic_slug":"programming-vivid-hosting-radio-issue","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/programming-vivid-hosting-radio-issue/496135/2","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3561325,"name":"jdao","username":"jdao","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jdao/{size}/160969_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-19T00:54:00.207Z","cooked":"

For the first radio, did you flip the 2.4 GHz DIP switch to ON on the back of the radio (switch #3) after re-programming the radio’s WPA keys? For the second radio, how did you try to connect to it? Did you use the Network Assistant Tool to try to locate the radio? If so, is the Ethernet interface you used set to DHCP?

What happened to this?

I second using the network assistant tool, it’s very likely you do not have your IP settings correct to see the radio config page

We were able to get both to work (shown in other post).

The switch was set to on, but we changed some IP settings to how the site said to, and redid the configuration and it worked.
